title: Seafood Linguine
ingredients: 1 bunch of fresh flat-leaf parsley (30g), finely chopped
Zest of ½ a lemon, finely grated
1 fresh red chilli, finely chopped (if using)
Extra virgin olive oil, for finishing
instructions: Cook the dried linguine in a large pan of boiling salted water according to the packet instructions. Drain, reserving a mugful of starchy water.
Slice the squid into 1cm rings.
Sort through the mussels and cockles (or clams), discarding any that aren’t tightly closed.
Slice the scallops.
Peel and finely slice the garlic.
Pick and finely chop the fresh flat-leaf parsley.
Finely grate the zest of ½ a lemon.
Trim and finely chop the fresh red chilli (if using).
Place a large non-stick pan on medium-high heat with olive oil. Add the garlic, chilli, and baby capers. Cook for 1 minute.
Add the clams and mussels. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Add the squid, scallops, lemon zest, and parsley. Stir well.
Scrunch in the plum tomatoes by hand. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 2 minutes, stirring regularly and breaking up the tomatoes.
Stir in the samphire (if using) and squeeze in the lemon juice. Simmer for 1 minute more, or until seafood is perfectly cooked.
Remove the pan from the heat. Carefully pick the meat out of the shells, if desired.
Grate in the Parmesan. Taste and season, adding extra lemon juice if needed.
Toss the cooked linguine into the sauce, loosening with a splash of reserved pasta water if needed.
Finish with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil before serving.

title: Lasagna
instructions: Cook the lasagna noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, cook the ground beef, onion, and garlic until the beef is browned. Drain excess fat.
Stir in the tomato sauce and Italian seasoning. Season with salt and pepper.
In a separate bowl, mix ricotta cheese and grated Parmesan.
Preheat the oven to a moderate temperature.
In a baking dish, layer lasagna noodles, meat sauce, ricotta mixture, and shredded mozzarella. Repeat layers.
Bake the lasagna in the preheated oven until bubbly and golden on top.
Let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

title: Nigerian Jollof Rice
instructions: In a pot, heat vegetable oil and sauté chopped onions until translucent.
Add blended red bell peppers and tomatoes. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Stir in tomato paste, thyme, curry powder, white pepper, paprika, and salt.
Pour in the chicken or vegetable broth and bring to a simmer.
Add parboiled rice and stir to coat with the tomato stew.
Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the rice is cooked and has absorbed the flavors.
Fluff the rice with a fork and serve with your choice of protein.

title: Chinese Orange Chicken
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken pieces, cut into bite-sized chunks
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together orange juice, orange zest, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, minced ginger, and minced garlic.
Marinate the chicken pieces in half of the sauce for at least 30 minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix cornstarch and water to create a slurry.
Heat oil in a pan for frying. Coat marinated chicken in cornstarch slurry and fry until golden and crispy.
In another pan, heat the remaining sauce until it thickens.
Toss fried chicken in the thickened sauce until coated.
Serve the orange chicken over rice and garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds.

title: Kenyan Ugali and Sukuma Wiki
instructions: In a pot, bring water to a boil.
Slowly add maize flour while stirring continuously to prevent lumps. Keep stirring until the mixture thickens.
Cover the pot and let the ugali cook for a few more minutes.
In a separate pan, heat vegetable oil and sauté chopped onions and minced garlic until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Stir in chopped sukuma wiki and cook until wilted.
Season with salt and serve the sukuma wiki alongside the ugali.

title: Ghanaian Kelewele
ingredients: 4 ripe plantains, peeled and cut into chunks
instructions: In a bowl, mix minced ginger, cayenne pepper, ground coriander, ground cloves, ground nutmeg, and salt to create a spice mix.
Toss the plantain chunks in the spice mix until coated.
Heat oil in a pan for frying.
Fry the spiced plantains until they are golden and crispy.
Remove from the oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve the kelewele as a spicy and flavorful snack.

title: Tom Yum Soup
instructions: Boil 4 cups of water in a pot.
Add lemongrass, galangal, and lime leaves.
Stir in shrimp and chili paste.
Simmer for 5 minutes and serve hot.

title: Green Curry
instructions: In a pot, heat the coconut milk and green curry paste. Add the chicken and simmer until cooked.
Add bamboo shoots, kaffir lime leaves, and Thai eggplants. Season with fish sauce and sugar.
Simmer until the vegetables are tender. Garnish with Thai basil leaves.

title: Pad Thai
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water until soft. Drain and set aside.
In a wok, heat oil, add garlic and prawns. Cook until prawns turn pink.
Push prawns to the side, add beaten eggs, and scramble.
Add noodles, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and sugar. Stir-fry until well combined.
Serve with bean sprouts and chopped peanuts.

title: Mango Sticky Rice
instructions: Rinse rice and soak in water for an hour. Drain, then steam until cooked.
In a saucepan, heat coconut milk, sugar, and salt until sugar dissolves.
Serve rice with mango slices, drizzle with coconut milk, and sprinkle sesame seeds.

title: Tom Kha Gai (Chicken Coconut Soup)
instructions: In a pot, combine coconut milk and chicken broth. Add galangal, kaffir lime leaves, bird's eye chilies, and lemongrass.
Add chicken and mushrooms. Cook until chicken is done.
Season with fish sauce and lime juice. Serve hot.

title: Som Tum (Green Papaya Salad)
instructions: In a mortar, crush garlic and chilies. Add palm sugar and pound.
Add fish sauce and lime juice. Adjust the taste.
Toss papaya, cherry tomatoes, and dressing together.
Garnish with roasted peanuts.

title: Massaman Curry
instructions: In a pot, heat some coconut milk and massaman curry paste. Add beef and cook until browned.
Add the rest of the coconut milk and remaining ingredients.
Simmer until beef and potatoes are tender. Serve with rice.

title: Red Snapper with Thai Chili Sauce
instructions: Score the fish, rub with salt, and fry until golden brown on both sides.
In a separate pan, heat some oil, add red curry paste, and stir until fragrant.
Add kaffir lime leaves, chilies, fish sauce, and sugar. Cook until it thickens.
Pour the sauce over the fried fish and serve.

title: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a separate pan, sauté the guanciale or pancetta until crispy. Add minced garlic and cook briefly.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs and mix in Pecorino Romano and Parmesan cheese. Season with black pepper.
Toss the cooked pasta in the pan with the guanciale and garlic. Remove from heat and combine with the egg-cheese mixture.
Serve immediately with a garnish of fresh parsley and additional grated cheese.

title: Margherita Pizza
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to the highest setting.
Roll out the pizza dough and spread tomato sauce evenly over it.
Arrange fresh mozzarella slices and basil leaves on top.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and black pepper.
Bake until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned.
Slice and serve your delicious Margherita pizza.

title: Risotto alla Milanese
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat the broth in a saucepan and add saffron threads to infuse the flavor.
In a separate pan, heat the butter and olive oil. Sauté the chopped onion until translucent.
Stir in Arborio rice and cook until it turns translucent.
Deglaze with white wine and cook until it evaporates.
Add a ladle of saffron-infused broth at a time and stir until absorbed. Continue until the rice is creamy and cooked al dente.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Serve the Risotto alla Milanese with a sprinkle of saffron threads on top.

title: Tiramisu
instructions: In a heatproof bowl, whisk together egg yolks and granulated sugar over a double boiler until creamy and thickened.
Remove from heat and whisk in mascarpone cheese until smooth.
In a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold the whipped cream into the mascarpone mixture.
Dip ladyfinger cookies into brewed coffee and layer them in a serving dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the cookies.
Repeat with another layer of dipped cookies and the remaining mascarpone mixture.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours.
Before serving, dust with cocoa powder and add a splash of coffee liqueur if desired.

title: Minestrone Soup
ingredients: 1 can (400g) cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook small pasta in a separate pot according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large pot, sauté chopped onion, minced garlic, diced carrots, celery, and zucchini until softened.
Stir in diced tomatoes, cannellini beans, dried basil, and dried oregano.
Add vegetable broth, season with salt and black pepper, and bring to a simmer. Simmer for about 20 minutes.
Divide cooked pasta among serving bowls and ladle the hot soup over it.
Serve with grated Parmesan cheese and garnish with fresh basil leaves.

title: Eggplant Parmesan
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Salt eggplant slices and let them sit for 30 minutes to release excess moisture. Pat dry with paper towels.
Dip eggplant slices into beaten eggs, then coat with breadcrumbs.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil and fry eggplant slices until golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
In a baking dish, layer marinara sauce, fried eggplant, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese. Repeat layers.
Bake in the oven until the cheese is bubbly and golden.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.

title: Panna Cotta
instructions: In a saucepan, heat heavy cream and sugar over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Stir in vanilla extract.
In a small bowl, sprinkle gelatin over cold water and let it bloom for a few minutes.
Stir the bloomed gelatin into the warm cream mixture until completely dissolved.
Pour the mixture into ramekins or molds and refrigerate for at least 4 hours to set.
Before serving, dip the molds briefly into hot water to loosen the panna cotta. Invert onto serving plates.
Garnish with fresh berries and mint leaves.

title: Chicken Parmesan
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
Dip each chicken breast into beaten eggs, then coat with breadcrumbs.
In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil and fry chicken breasts until golden and cooked through.
Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
In a baking dish, layer marinara sauce, fried chicken, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese. Repeat layers.
Bake in the oven until the cheese is bubbly and golden.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.

title: Greek Salad
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Combine cucumbers, tomatoes, red onion, olives, and feta cheese in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Serve chilled.

title: Moussaka
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large pan, brown the meat with onions and garlic. Drain excess fat.
Add tomatoes, wine, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes.
In a separate pan, fry eggplant and potato slices until golden brown.
In a baking dish, layer potato, eggplant, meat sauce, and béchamel sauce. Repeat layers.
Top with Parmesan cheese and bake until golden.

title: Tzatziki
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Place grated cucumber in a clean kitchen towel and squeeze to remove excess liquid.
In a bowl, combine grated cucumber, yogurt, garlic, dill, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Mix well and refrigerate for at least an hour before serving.

title: Souvlaki
ingredients: 1 pound boneless chicken or pork, cubed
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a bowl, combine olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Add cubed meat and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Thread meat onto skewers and grill until cooked through. Serve with pita and tzatziki.

title: Spanakopita
ingredients: 1 package frozen spinach, thawed and drained
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a bowl, combine spinach, feta cheese, Parmesan cheese, garlic, dill, parsley, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Layer phyllo pastry sheets, brushing each with olive oil.
Spread the spinach mixture over the pastry, then layer more sheets on top.
Bake until golden brown and crispy.

title: Greek Lemon Roasted Potatoes
ingredients: 4 large potatoes, peeled and cut into wedges
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a bowl, combine potatoes, olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Toss to coat potatoes in the mixture.
Arrange the potatoes in a baking dish and roast until golden and tender.

title: Stuffed Chicken Breast
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut a pocket in each chicken breast.
Combine spinach, feta, garlic, dill, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Stuff each chicken breast with the spinach mixture.
Brush with olive oil and bake until chicken is cooked through.

title: Greek Baklava
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Combine walnuts and cinnamon in a bowl.
Layer phyllo pastry sheets, brushing each with melted butter and sprinkling with the nut mixture.
Cut into diamond or square shapes and bake until golden brown.
In a saucepan, combine sugar, water, and honey. Simmer until sugar is dissolved.
Pour syrup over the baked baklava. Let cool before serving.
